@ggreenwald @lhfang And this is true on every level. Poor and working-class pleasures like eating a chicken sandwich are destroying the planet, not the Pentagon and its endless wars.

@iamungit @joe_shipman I mean, how ideologically oriented are Facebook Twitter that they can continue to destroy their businesses? We had several decades of an open internet, so closing that down entirely seems unlikely.

@iamungit @joe_shipman I also said losing all social sway. Meaning that what CNN says is truth means less than many other figures. That is true now, and will continue. The only thing they can do to stop it is censorship, and I think they are already having troubles escalating that.

@iamungit @joe_shipman And even if these were more normal times, the pendulum in the 2020s is almost certainly going towards conservatism (generally 10-20 year cycles). The MSM are way over-extended on wokeness. Even putting aside Covid lockdowns, election, and so much more.

@iamungit @joe_shipman Sure, they might be able to stay afloat from investors or different games like airports paying them, but we're in the midst of a long-term crisis in belief, to where Jimmy Dore already imho already has more cultural impact than Brian Stelter. That gap will continue to widen.
@joe_shipman @iamungit I doubt that dynamic will last past the decade. There is not a lot of stability or trust in this system, and media will be one of the first institutions to fall.
